Description: Papyrus; seventeen lines of Hieratic text. Letter from the mayor Mentuhotep to the scribe Ahmose, about the construction of a house.
Curator's comments: From other sources in the BM and the Louvre, we know that Ahmose was an assistant of the Director of Works, Peniaty. Ahmose is asked in the letter to inform the builder Amenmose of the desired heights for walls and doorways, suggesting that Ahmose is overseeing the work on the house of Mentuhotep, perhaps as Peniaty’s deputy. Published: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 200
